title: Poisons, pests and people
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Pesticides - Toxicology
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Agricultural chemicals

Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Pesticides - Physiological effect
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Insect pests - Control
description: Produced in 1960, this still timely two-part film examines the effects of widespread chemical insecticide use, both on the insect population and on warm-blooded creatures, including humans. Part 1 looks at the ravages of insects and the centuries-old struggle to control them. Part 2 shows experiments being conducted to find ways of controlling specific insects, while leaving harmless ones unaffected.
